text: Psalm 39
The Brevity of Human Life

For the \add music\add* director. For Jeduthun.\f + \fr Ps 39 \ft One of David’s musicians (\xt 1 Chr 16:41 \ft ) \f* A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 39 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
I said, “I will guard my ways
⸤that I may not sin⸥\f + \fr 39:1 \ft Literally “from sinning” \f* with my tongue.
I will keep a muzzle over my mouth
as long as \add the\add* wicked \add are\add* before me.”
I was mute \add with\add* silence. I was silent \add even\add* from \add saying\add* good \add things\add*,
and my pain was stirred up.
My heart grew hot inside me;
in my sighing a fire burned.
\add Then\add* I spoke with my tongue,
“Let me know, O Yahweh, my end,
and what is the measure of my days.
Let me know how transient I \add am\add*.”
Look, you have made my days \add mere\add* handbreadths,
and my lifespan as nothing next to you.
Surely every person standing firm \add is\add* complete vanity. \qs Selah\qs*
Surely a man walks about as a \add mere\add* ⸤shadow⸥;\f + \fr 39:6 \ft Literally “image” \f*
surely in vain they bustle about.
He heaps up \add possessions\add* but does not know who \add will\add* gather them \add in\add*.
And now, O Lord, for what do I wait?
My hope is for you.
From all my transgressions deliver me;
do not make me \add the\add* taunt of \add the\add* fool.
I am mute. I do not open my mouth,
for you, yourself, have done \add it\add*.
Remove from me your affliction.
By the opposition of your hand I perish.
\add When\add* with rebukes you chastise a man for sin,
you\f + \fr 39:11 \ft Hebrew “and/then you” \f* ⸤consume⸥\f + \fr 39:11 \ft Literally “cause to melt” \f* like a moth his delightful \add things\add*.
Surely everyone \add is\add* a \add mere\add* vapor.\f + \fr 39:11 \ft The word translated “vanity” in vv. \xt 6 \ft , 7 \f* \qs Selah\qs*
Hear my prayer, O Yahweh, and listen \add to\add* my cry for help;
do not be deaf to my tears.
For I \add am\add* an alien\f + \fr 39:12 \ft Or “stranger” \f* with you,
a sojourner like all my ancestors.\f + \fr 39:12 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
Look \add away\add* from me that I may be cheerful,
before I depart and I am no more.
